intro: Jaltomata angasmarcae, commonly known as the Angasmarca yellowflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are generally ovate to elliptic in shape, with a hairy surface. Jaltomata angasmarcae is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
